'''Drapion''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ドラピオン''' ''Dorapion'') is a dual-type {{2t|Poison|Dark}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation IV]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s from {{p|Skorupi}} starting at [[level]] 40.

==Biology==
Drapion is a large, purple, scorpion-like Pokémon. Its eyes are a pointed shape, with blue-colored upper portions. Drapion has two small, pointed protrusions between its eyes, and one on the back on its head. Drapion also has protrusions on its jaws, two on the upper and three on the lower, with large, fang-like, white-colored features extending from its mouth. Its body is composed of many violet-to-lavender body segments which ends with a tail with two stingers. Drapion has four segmented legs with pointed toes. Its most distinguished feature is its huge claws. It can turn its head 180 degrees.

Drapion is a very aggressive Pokémon, attacking anything that enters its territory. It has a sturdy build and takes pride in its strength, being able to take down foes even without the use of its deadly toxin. It has enough power to easily scrap a car.

==In the anime==
[[File:Celosia Drapion.png|thumb|left|250px|Drapion in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Drapion debuted in ''[[DP020|Mutiny in the Bounty!]]'', under [[J|Pokémon Hunter J]]'s ownership.

{{EF|Aaron}}'s Drapion appeared in ''[[DP099|A Trainer and Child Reunion!]]''.

[[Paul]] has a Drapion, which he used to battle Ash in ''[[DP186|Familiarity Breeds Strategy!]]'', ''[[DP187|A Real Rival Rouser!]]'', and ''[[DP188|Battling a Thaw in Relations!]]''. It managed to defeat {{AP|Buizel}}, {{AP|Staraptor}}, and {{AP|Torterra}} before losing to {{AP|Gliscor}}. It is unknown whether it is the same one he tried to capture in ''[[DP081|Chim - Charred!]]''.

A Drapion debuted in ''[[XY094|From A to Z!]]'', under the ownership of [[Celosia]].

===Minor appearances===
A Drapion was used by one of the students of [[Pokémon Summer Academy]] in the first leg of the [[Pokémon Triathlon]] in ''[[DP091|One Team, Two Team, Red Team, Blue Team!]]''.

[[Reggie]] used a Drapion to battle {{FB|Pyramid King|Brandon}}, as shown in a flashback in ''[[DP128|A Pyramiding Rage!]]''.

A Drapion appeared in the opening sequences of ''[[M10|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]'' and ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Scientist Kricketune Drapion Adventures.png|thumb|Drapion in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
In ''[[PS362|Dramatic Drapion & Crafty Kricketune I]]'', two {{tc|Scientist}}s working for [[Team Galactic]] fought {{adv|Diamond}}, {{adv|Pearl}}, and {{adv|Platinum}} while guarding [[Lake Valor]]. One of these scientists used a Drapion, whose ability to turn its head 180 degrees angle it to find Diamond's hiding {{p|Munchlax}}, {{adv|Lax}}, with ease.

A Trainer's Drapion appeared in ''[[PS418|Deprogramming Porygon-Z]]''.

Like in the games, {{EF|Aaron}} has a Drapion. It first appeared in ''[[PS423|Tackling Togekiss]]''.

A Drapion appeared in ''[[PAXY30|Pinsir Changes]]''.

===In the Pokémon Diamond and Pearl Adventure! manga===
[[B-2]] of [[Team Galactic]] uses a Drapion while attacking [[Hareta]] on [[Iron Island]] in ''[[DPA10|Serious Training on Iron Island!!]]''. The ensuing battle causes Hareta's {{p|Shinx}} to evolve into {{p|Luxio}}.

Another Drapion was conditioned by [[Charon]] into a mindless battle machine in ''[[DPA32|Charon Must Be Stopped!]]''.

===In the Pocket Monsters Platinum: Aim to Be Battle King!! manga===
Drapion appeared under the ownership of an unknown Trainer who battled [[Yū Shirogane|Yū]]'s {{p|Lucario}}.

===In the Pokémon Ranger Vatonage - the Comic manga===
Like in [[Pokémon Ranger: Shadows of Almia]], [[Kincaid]] controls a Drapion and uses it against [[Kellyn]].

==Trivia==
* Drapion was designed by [[Kenkichi Toyama]].

===Origin===
Drapion is based on a {{wp|scorpion}}, and has some characteristics that resemble a {{wp|Thelyphonida|vinegarroon}} (a similar arachnid). Its {{egg|Water 3}} Egg Group designation may be a reference to the ancient group of arthropods known as {{wp|Eurypterid|sea scorpions}} that used to inhabit the oceans and may have been the ancestors of modern scorpions.

====Name origin====
Drapion and Dorapion may be a combination of ''dragon'', ''drastic'' (referring to its violent nature), or ''Dracula'' (referring to its huge vampire-looking teeth) and ''{{wp|scorpion}}''.
